passage: The present invention discloses an installation method for a prefabricated beam used in prefabricated building construction, aiming to enhance overall economy. The component is mainly composed of fiber-reinforced concrete, with a design strength level of C50, to meet the technical requirements of high-rise building load requirements. The installation steps during construction sequentially include: reserving lifting holes, installing bottom wall panels, hoisting roof slab. To ensure structural stability and reliable connections, the anchoring element is firmly connected to the lifting hole through grouting, which helps enhance the overall cooperative performance among structural components. Furthermore, no additional formwork support is required during construction, thus saving construction time and labor costs, suitable for various complex site conditions.

Furthermore, no additional formwork support is required during construction, thus saving construction time and labor costs, suitable for various complex site conditions.

passage: The present invention discloses an installation method for a prefabricated beam used in prefabricated building construction, aiming to enhance overall construction speed. The component is mainly composed of fiber-reinforced concrete, with a design strength level of C10, to meet the technical requirements of seismic design standards. The installation steps during construction sequentially include: hoisting roof slab, reserving lifting holes, pouring foundation concrete. To ensure structural stability and reliable connections, the anchoring element is firmly connected to the embedded part through dry connection, which helps enhance the overall cooperative performance among structural components. Furthermore, no additional formwork support is required during construction, thus saving construction time and labor costs, suitable for various complex site conditions.

passage: The present invention discloses an installation method for a prefabricated wall panel used in prefabricated building construction, aiming to enhance overall construction speed. The component is mainly composed of lightweight concrete, with a design strength level of C30, to meet the technical requirements of high-rise building load requirements. The installation steps during construction sequentially include: hoisting roof slab, reserving lifting holes, pouring foundation concrete. To ensure structural stability and reliable connections, the embedded part is firmly connected to the connector through bolting, which helps enhance the overall cooperative performance among structural components. Furthermore, no additional formwork support is required during construction, thus saving construction time and labor costs, suitable for various complex site conditions.
